expansion card.translation[0].definition: a circuit board that fits into a computer and makes it possible for the computer to do more things, for example produce sounds, play CD ROMs, or use a telephone line
expansion card.translation[1].definition: a CIRCUIT BOARD that fits into a computer and makes it possible to add extra features to the computer. Examples of expansion cards are SOUNDCARDs, VIDEO CARDs,  and MODEMs
